Key Match Events: Astros fell short of repeating as World Series champions
Jose Altuve hit a dramatic three-run homer in the ninth inning to win Game 5 of the ALCS
Adolis García was named ALCS Most Valuable Player with four hits and five RBIs, including two home runs
Pre-Game Insights: Astros third baseman Alex Bregman said 'Definitely not what you want' when asked about the team's performance
Astros catcher Martín Maldonado said 'I think for us to be a success is winning the World Series'
Post-Match Reflections: Astros manager Dusty Baker spoke to the club and told the players he appreciated their fight and their effort
Baker isn't expected to return as manager with his contract expiring
Maldonado said 'At the same time, I feel like as a team we accomplished a lot of stuff. It wasn’t easy all year. We had a lot of injuries, and I’m really proud of this group of guys.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers struck for three runs in the first inning against Astros starter Cristian Javier
The Astros lost 22 of their final 29 games at home, including the playoffs
The Rangers outscored the Astros, 20-6, in Games 6 and 7 in Houston
Others: The 74-year-old Baker isn’t expected to return as manager with his contract expiring
The Astros became the second team to lose four games at home in a playoff series
